thread.title: Tennis Player Agrees To Go On Date After Losing Super Bowl Twitter Bet
thread.title_full: Tennis Player Agrees To Go On Date After Losing Super Bowl Twitter Bet

author: David Moye
title: Tennis Player Agrees To Go On Date After Losing Super Bowl Twitter Bet

organizations.name: huffington post brad barket/getty images tennis

text:
Tennis Player Agrees To Go On Date After Losing Super Bowl Twitter Bet "Lesson learned. Never bet against Tom Brady." 02/06/2017 06:46 pm ET David Moye Reporter, The Huffington Post Brad Barket/Getty Images Tennis player Eugenie Bouchard, 22, was positive the Atlanta Falcons would win. 
Itâ€™s a sure bet that tennis star Eugenie Bouchard wonâ€™t make any more Super Bowl wagers with Twitter followers. 
When the Atlanta Falcons were up by 21 points during the first half Sunday, the 22-year-old Canadian posted a tweet in support of the Dirty Birds. I knew Atlanta would win btw â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 
One of her Twitter followers, John Goerhke, wasnâ€™t willing to follow her down that particular path and challenged her to a friendly Super Bowl bet. @geniebouchard if patriots win we go on a date? â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 
But Goehrke, a 20-year-old marketing major at the University of Missouri, had a feeling Tom Brady would find a way to come back. 
â€œI saw the tweet and Iâ€™m like, I wasnâ€™t assuming the game was over because I knew how good the Patriots were and how good Tom Brady was, but I was like, I donâ€™t think this is over,â€ Goehrke told The Chicago Tribune. â€œI thought it would be funny to comment something just to say whatever, like, â€˜Youâ€™re crazy if you think this is over.â€™ ... But then I thought I could have more fun with it and do something else, so I thought of that.â€ 
Bouchardâ€™s reactions as the Patriots came back and she realized she might possibly be going on a date with a stranger were immortalized on her Twitter page. 
First she got embarrassed. â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 
Then she freaked out. â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 
Then she became pragmatic. â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 
Then she became philosophical. â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 
Bouchard was still processing the loss on Monday morning. Omg...last night really happened... pic.twitter.com/WVxdKPYV68 â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 
But Bouchard is a woman of honor and said she would stand by the bet she made with Goehrke. Lol it made a Twitter moment. And I will do it, I stay true to my word ğŸ™ğŸ¼ pic.twitter.com/0rOUc0xJsC â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 
Goehrke is still waiting for Bouchardâ€™s reps to contact him to set up a date. Heâ€™s also scoping out Chicago hot spots she might enjoy. 
â€œHonestly, if Iâ€™m even lucky enough for it to happen and I meet her, that would be good enough,â€ he told The Chicago Tribune. â€œDepending on where she wants to meet or what she wants to do, Iâ€™m going to try to take her to dinner. See what happens.â€ 
Whether it works out to be a love match for the tennis star remains to be seen. She has been linked to Jordan Caron, a hockey player in the Boston Bruins system, according to HockeyFeed.com. Also on HuffPost
